name: Vanessa Brown
text: This place is amazing! Friendly owners who are very knowledgeable and easy to talk to. Their dog is precious and loves to cuddle as well. The wine is delicious to say the least! The wine is $8 a bottle, but right now they have a buy 3 get 1 free special. Their jam is delicious and only $2.50 a jar. Simply put, I'll be a regular there! :)

name: Rachel Graham
text: A great treasure in Perry County!! We went in for a wine tasting and got so much more.  Tim and Vickey shared stories from their trip to the California wineries that began their interest as well as details about each of the wines we tasted and the process that goes into making them.  We tasted all the wines in stock and selected our favorites.  This is all logged on a card that they will pull for you when you come back.  The wines were very reasonably priced at $8.00 per bottle and if you buy 3 you get the fourth bottle FREE.  I also purchased a small jar of Muscadine Jelly and a wine glass with their logo.  My favorite wines were the Scuppuernong Semi Sweet, LCV Red and Black Spanish.  The wine is all labeled with Perry County, this makes for a nice memento for someone who has ties to Perry County or for the collector who likes wines from local vineyards.   Please go by and see Tim and Vickey, they have created a little slice of heaven for us wine lovers right in Perry County.

name: Sherry Joiner
text: My husband David came through the door this afternoon with a case of your wine. We opened a bottle and it was wonderful! We are giving out the wine for Mothers Day. Thank you for the glasses and I would like to buy a few of them also. I will send him back for them soon :)

name: Grace Ballard
text: Bought 2 bottles, one for myself and one as a birthday gift for my daughter in law. Great wine.  Different from what we would normally buy. A nice change.

name: Max Podium
text: Best wine I've ever tasted. Wish you guys were near Montgomery, this would be my weekly pick.

name: Sue Rhiney Nichols
text: We recently visited Log Cabin Vineyard and Winery for a wine tasting benefit. It was our first visit to LCV and we were pleasantly surprised to discover this hidden gem so close to home.  A short drive off the highway through a stand of pine trees, LCV offers a beautiful setting in rural Perry County in central Alabama (approximately 15 miles from Selma), complete with rocking chairs on a long covered porch overlooking the lush vineyard. The cozy tasting room was comfortable and inviting, with barstool seating and sofa/chair seating, and we enjoyed talking with owners Tim and Vickey Letson and learning about their operation. LCV is definitely worth a visit! We will be there again soon!

name: S. Foster
text: Absolutely amazing!

name: Jerry Allen
text: Fantastic food at a great price. Thank you guys so much! So friendly and down to earth. This place is a gem! 💎

name: Joyce Robinson
text: Great service and food

resp.text: Thank you for coming and sharing a meal at lighthouse cafe. Thank you for the 5 stars. Hope to see you again.

name: Susan Nettles
text: The food is wonderful! The bbq is crazy good, the burgers are huge and taste like a backyard cookout. Delicious!  Even the salad and seafood is great. The staff is very friendly and you know they appreciate your business.  Clean, friendly, excellent food....what's not to love?  And try their lemonade. Perfect!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your five stars. We aim to please.

name: kathy Simmons
text: The food was good hot and fresh ! I wished I could have had  the pleasure of dining in . Would recommend to anyone !

resp.text: Thank you for stopping by. And glad you enjoyed your meal. We look forward to seeing you in the near future once the dining room reopens due to COVID-19 concerns. But for now we will continue our curbside service.

name: Jenna Leigh's Beauty Slam
text: This is totally one of those local, mom and pop type places I'd recommend to out of towners! A tiny yet cute dining room- May be 6-7 small tables all decorated with Alabama Football memorabilia and cute trinkets is cozy and surprisingly quiet given its proximity to busy St. Stephens road is perfect for the menu- burgers, fries, chicken, soul food... The "Fat Albert" burger is their trademark dish... And oh my gosh its HUGE! delicious food and great service!

resp.text: Thank you for visiting.and thank you for the 5 stars. Glad things were to your liking. Hope to see you again. Again  thank you

name: Allgood's Unlisted (Stuart Allgood)
text:
The Big Albert is the best burger in the Mobile area. No contest. Even better than Callahan's.
And great chicken too. Every time our crew is in the area, we always swing by.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting.  Hope to see you guys next time you're  in the area. Thanks for the five stars.

name: Becky Moore
text: It takes a few minutes to get your order but it's well worth the wait.  The Fat Albert burger is one of the best burgers I've ever tasted, made with fresh ground beef and loaded with fixins. The foot long Wow Dog is also delicious. It's cozy and clean inside and family run with friendly service.  Lighthouse Cafe is my favorite place to eat in Eight Mile.

resp.text: Thank you for the five stars. We thank you for your support.  And we are Glad you enjoyed. We are here to please.  Our motto is when you're here you are family.

name: Carlotta Arradondo
text: The best hamburgers in Mobile and the staff are always welcoming and professional! I moved to Alabama went to this place and I’ve thoroughly enjoyed the service and the food. Don’t let the location keep you from discovering a great burger and consistently great service , it’s worth the drive!!!  Thanks L.H cafe!!

resp.text: Thanks for your five-star review.

The service was friendly and helpful, the atmosphere was pleasant, the smell was amazing. It was a bit hard to find initially because I came from the wrong direction. Now that I know where it is, I will be a regular.

text: Friendly people and delicious, homemade food.. highly recommend the brownies!

name: Briana Garrison
text: Excellent chicken salad, I prefer mine on croissant. My favorite side is the strawberry pretzel salad and my favorite desserts are the brownies and carrot cake, although the caramel cake is a close third. They are very happy to have groups that visit for a while.

name: Adrienne Lanza
text: Everything I have ordered here was good especially the chicken salad.  Staff is very nice.  Pricey for the amount of food you get i.e. 1 sandwich with meat and cheese is 8 dollars.

name: Elijah Mcquaid
text: The chicken salad was amazing.

name: Kyle Brown
text: Burger was good. Fries were undercooked so made me new ones. Took awhile for the fries but they made it right.

resp.text: Thanks Kyle! We'll always try to make it right if you let us know!

name: Jessica Dial
text:
Visited on Saturday at lunch. Was so thankful they were open because literally anything else worth eating was closed. We didn’t know this place existed until we happened upon it. So naturally we were thrilled to eat something local, rather than fast food!
They got slammed right as we arrived so they struggled a bit to stay on top, but I believe they handled it pretty well and wait time still wasn’t bad! I had the philly chicken and it was delicious! Really greasy but still sooo good. One of my friends had a “seasoned” chicken salad. It was gross. I know having healthier options can be costly but my recommendation is to stick with the sandwiches, or for the owners to do a salad overhaul. A couple got the cheese curds. I wanted these to be good! But they were pretty flavorless, cold and undercooked French fries were soggy! But those sandwiches were the bomb! And the service was great, so friendly and helpful! Definitely would eat here again!

resp.text: Hi Jessica, Thanks for visiting! We're still working on getting great food out when business gets a little crazy; we'll take your comments into account. Have a great afternoon!

name: Will Mills
text: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. Girl sat at the counter for 5 min without informing us we needed to get up and walk to the counter to order. Lazy staff and expensive prices.

resp.text: Sorry you didn't enjoy your experience. Hope you'll try the food sometime if you didn't. Have a great day!

text: The food was alright in the morning as I heard it’s like a buffet where stuff gets old the longer it’s in the steam table. When I ordered some of there foods in the morning it was top notch, but I came a little late and the food was just basically not even possible to eat. Overall the staffs and service was nice but you need to be there at a specific time

name: Court Campbell
text: He wouldnt give me my change back saying he didnt have change he owed me .85, I tried giving him .15 for $1 & he said he was good. Just a .85 rip off but it is the principle. Also the food was old & hard. I asked for a refund, he refused saying he can replace with different food that was also sitting out like if its bad it's bad no thank you. Will never come back here, I dont usually leave reviews but this is just nasty. I also ordered a sweet tea which he then told me the drink machine is down, if you dont have anything else you should at least make the effort to make tea 🤦‍♀️🤦‍♀️🤦‍♀️

Don't know what happened here but food quality has gone downhill. Used to be our favorite place to eat at the mall, not any more . (BTW this is second time in 2 months so it's not just a bad day.)

name: Dorothy Peters
text: My husband & I agree that this is the BEST snow cone we've ever had! My husband is a snow cone snob and we've had snow cones everywhere including the famous Matsumoto's in Hawaii (which used to be our #1 snow cone pick) and this place beats them all. The snow cones are super creative and delicious! I don't know how they do it, but the ice somehow has a smooth and creamy texture, while still maintaining that traditional snow cone quality that we all enjoy. Definitely recommend this place!

name: Leigh Sutton
text: The ONLY place to get snow cones ! Amazing

name: Michele Keepers
text: Got to enjoy a delicious snow cone inside on this visit. Service was just as good as the treat!

name: Ashton Johnson
text: Always tasty. Great variety.

name: Wilburn Martin
text: I've eaten here once years ago it took me a minute to remember why/when I was there. I was there for work an spoke a very nice guy(owner?) about lighting for their parking area. As best I can remember the food was good here. The location seemed to be very clean and well kept. Had I went to this location before I had taken my lunch break I would have eaten here. I would have then been able to say how tasty the food is, but by appearances and after speaking with the guy I felt they ranked at least a 4 star. Nice family restaurant that I will stop by on my next trip to the area.

name: LaShandra Hatcher
text:
I had visited Richardson’s Cafe back when they first opened because I was so happy we had a new business down this way. They were just getting started when the pandemic came along. I decided to visit again today and spoke with Mrs. Richardson. She is so nice and professional and even suggested some of her favorites. I ordered the Whiting combo with fried okra and French fries. Everything was good with good portions! I also got lemonade as my beverage choice. It was so good I wish I had another one. The okra was also cooked perfectly. (I’m embarrassed to say I ate the entire plate of food.)
I am glad I stopped by and will be back to try other items. (I heard they are also serving breakfast on certain days.) Thank you for your hard work and for opening up a restaurant to serve our community!

name: S Hall
text: Wonderful place . Food is very good the people are awesome ❤️❤️❤️

text: So good, I had to pull over and I live right down the street!😍😍😍

Food-great!

A good place to recommend friends, family  and out of town guests.
If any misunderstanding with there services.
Please contact or speak to Mr or Mrs Richardson.
Richardson family keep doing your thang.
Thanks for your service.
Mr Glenn!😎🙏❤🌹
Old Schooler, Tuscaloosa, Alabama

text: Richardson is always on point! The Pollard Family loves this establishment and happy the have came to this spot. We are regulars and always here bc the food is delicious and service with a smile 🙂

text:
I am NOT a big fan of club sandwiches, but the young lady taking the order said that was their best sandwich so I ordered one. This was the best club I have ever eaten!!
The owner came by to check on my order and to see if I needed anything else with my meal!
Impressed!!

name: Krystale Howard
text: Food is great I'm never disappointed. Go check them out.

name: Kris Jay
text: The food is very good. And yes i agree with the other post. The fish is great. Service is excellent.

text: Love the food and the environment

text: Love it

resp.text: Thank you for your support

name: Scott Seeley
text: Excellent place to stroll. No crowds.

name: Maria Hawthorne
text: This is a very cute shop on the Main Street on Dauphin Island. My husband and I spent nearly a week here in a vacation rental. Even though we had a beautiful, well-stocked kitchen I didn’t want to spend a lot of time cooking and we were tired of eating at restaurants. This place is a true gem. The owners are nice and friendly, the food is all excellent and made with high quality ingredients. We basically ate their food the whole time. There is an excellent selection. All you need to do is reheat the food in the microwave or oven. We only needed to buy drinks, salads and fruit. I wish this was franchised and located in every vacation spot with lots of home rentals.

name: nvhds3j8vs
text: Don't waste your vacation time waiting for a table at a restaurant- Dinner's Ready has got it covered.  We'd stop in on the way back to our rental from the beach.  Extremely friendly, easy prep, and DELICIOUS!

name: Richard Burchfield
text: I had the red beans and rice. It was amazing I would buy it by the gallon if they sold it.

name: Marie Pate
text: My husband, dog and I were visiting the island on our vacation to Mobile. We saw the great reviews and decided to pick up some dessert to take back to our Air bnb. I got a casserole for dinner too and some gingersnap cookies for my dog. He LOVED them. The owners were sooo sweet! And the food was all homemade and delicious!!! What a rare treat!

name: JULIE MASSEY
text: I stopped here while visiting Dauphin Island and the very nice ladies there made me a lunch box as I was on the road. The food was delicious! I highly recommend!

name: Ron Cruikshank
text: An experience every visitor to Dauphin  Island should have. The staff is fantastic and the food delicious.

name: Brian McMillin
text: We spent three nights in a guest house on Dauphin Island and enjoyed food from Dinner's Ready for nearly every meal. From their biscuits-and-gravy breakfast casserole to their key lime pie, we loved everything we purchased!

name: polly douglas
text: This is a find for sure! The ladies there are so sweet and they cook the most delightful things 😍. Very impressed.

name: Casey Stanfill
text: We frequent here!  I could write paragraphs about how much I love every thing about this place!  Try it, you won't be disappointed!!

name: Laura Kelter
text: Picked up enchilada casserole, Shepard’s pie, key lime pie and lemon ice box pie yesterday. They ladies were so wonderful, insuring we were aware of all the  ingredients in each dish as we have to be careful of food allergies. The ease of pick up was awesome. They are following strict covid guidelines that made us feel comfortable. AND THE FOOD WAS SO GOOD. Can you have key lime pie for breakfast?  We will be back next year. This made one night of cooking here so easy. Thank you.

name: Dennis Kern
text: Great meals ready to take home to heat and eat. Also have delicious pies and cakes. Didn't want to cook over the weekend so we got several dishes an just had to pop them in the oven or microwave.

name: Mark Hoyt
text:
Just picked up two key lime pies.
A from scratch pie made with love!!! (only way to describe it)
I have not had key lime pie of this quality since I was a child in Florida.
Next summer I will be ordering a pie every other day!
Can’t wait to try dinner!
Thank you

name: Jeanne Dunn
text: I cannot say enough good things about Dinner’s Ready. We have LOVED everything they prepare. Their Greek Lasagna is delicious! Their chicken and Conecah sausage gumbo is TO DIE FOR! We love their sliders. You just cannot go wrong with Dinner’s Ready!❤️❤️❤️

name: Sonya Carrell
text: Got our Thanksgiving turkey here.  It was DELICIOUS!

name: Levi Zindl
text: Genius idea! And delicious home cooked meals ready for you to heat up. Not a fryer in the building so that makes everything that much better! We had a great ravioli dinner and quiche Lorraine, and cookies and cream cupcakes.

name: Henry Roberts
text: Has some of the best gumbo I have ever had, and I’m straight out of Louisianan swamp. Maple cupcakes are also delicious.

name: Tami Lakey
text: Enjoyed the seasonal tomato pie today!  I've been waiting all summer to visit and buy one!  So fabulous!  The ladies are wonderful and I can't wait to visit again next summer!!!

text: Brownies = awesome!  Chicken salad was delish as was chicken and sausage jambalaya. Check on Facebook page for menu of the week!! You won't be disappointed!

text: The food is always warm and delicious but the service is horrible. I wait in line forever and I end up getting the wrong thing. Also, the same women is there every time I go and she is so rude! She rolls her eyes at me and doesn't greet me and never tells me my total, she just puts her hand out and waits for my card. PLUS their blueberry scones are very dry and not flavorful at all.

name: Noah Taylor
text: I was at UAB for the Science Olympiad event, and went in with a couple of friends. I wanted to try the Cherry Mocha Frappuchino and when I ordered, the lady working was somewhat rude and said, “No, I’m not making that because I’m here alone.” When there was only four of us in there and two people sitting and eating at a table. I went back later and got one when two people were working and she still acted annoyed about it.

name: James Drummond
text: The location is a franchise of sorts operated by Sodexo, the food service intermediary working on contract for the university. As a result, the service is not and will never be up to Starbucks's standards. This is less about the quality of the food & beverages, and more to do with the quality and friendliness of the servers. I personally have only had to deal with slow service, but that could happen at any time during a rush. The worst stories come from others; I have been around while the building was hosting an added-security event, which required the presence of LEOs; the baristas refused to provide him with a glass of water without charging him. At other foodservice locations in the same building and operated by the same company, not even students are charged for water glasses. That one event does a good job summarizing the apathy and disregard the employees have for their customers. Another critical issue is that this location doesn't accept Starbucks's own rewards program, which is extremely annoying after having signed up for the program just for the convenience of the location being in the same building that I work for. I've personally made a resolution to never purchase another item at this location again.

name: Matthew Pearson
text: Go to the one in Sterne. This place is a mess. Wrong size coffee, stale croissant, long wait.

text: I'm giving this place five stars because, of the service we received and the food was great too. The price for the food was more affordable than any place we have found on the beach. The view is also excellent because, the restaurant is on the fourth floor. Don't worry, elevator access is on the first floor.

text:
This place was awesome! Great Mexican food that isn't the same ol hum drum food in the area, the staff was friendly and attentive, the prices sealed the deal!
We will be back! The view was fantastic!  Jalapeno is a treasure in the area!

text: This place sucks!!!

name: kathleen dubey Davis
text: I tried there lasagna today and it was amazing! Definite go to place for catering or even family dinners you can pick up and bring home! Excited to try the other casseroles and choices in the future!

name: Jennifer Susman
text: This place is insanely good.  I'm normally not one for "lunch cafes" but I truly enjoy coming here.  Try anything off of the Clark's Kitchen menu and you will be glad you did!  The food is delicious, the restaurant is clean, service is fabulous, internet is free- what more can I say?  Love it here.  I'll be back tomorrow...again!

name: Doris Lepoma
text: I had Seafood Gumbo, It was just perfect,,,Almost like the Gumbo my husband and my mother-in law makes. It was a welcome treat foe  both me and my son. Also  perfect day to have our lunch outside/sidewalk. The pansies are beautiful.

name: Tommy Evans
text: Walked in to a decent atmosphere, pleasant enough staff, but we waited for 40 minutes for two small orders. I got half of what was ordered, my girlfriend didn't even get hers. And we wound up getting a refund and leaving. Short staffed or no they could have warned us, we wasted an entire afternoon and got nothing for it. Don't eat here. It was just bad.

name: ImUrUncleDaddy
text: Good food, ok prices, fast service, great deserts, and even have take home meals. Take home meals are great being a college student because it's enough to feed me all week. Stop by at least once a week now.

name: Destiny L
text:
I am a long time customer of Camile's, not because of the food, but because it is right next door to campus. I sometimes like to sit and grab a bite between classes. The food is bit bland, but I have never had any problems with my order. One day I did and was treated horribly for the complaint. I ordered the Camile club with no mayo. When I received my sandwich, it had mayo. So, I calmly went back up and explained that I didn't want mayo. I was told it could be fixed.

While waiting on my sandwich, I noticed the staff watching me and speaking quietly, but I ignored it. 5 minutes later I was called back and when I went to check my sandwich again, I noticed the residue from mayo. It looked as if someone had wiped the mayo off and changed the bread. Again, calmly, I went back up (once again noticing the staff snickering) and asked to speak to the manager for a refund. Said-manager whose name I couldn't get, claimed she was there the whole time they "remade" my sandwich and it was fresh. I told her that couldn't be the case because it was now cold, it took her less time to make it than originally and I showed her a piece of lettuce that had mayo in it.

She then rudely asked me if I still had my receipt, which I did. I was given a refund, but I don't appreciate the way I was treated. If I'm paying for a meal, I expect it to made the way I requested it. I didn't ask them to make me a sandwich befitting God. I just didn't want mayo.  I am never stepping foot into that cafe again.

name: donrico browne
text: Love it friendly staff and the food was delicious  prices very affordable  definitely  would dine in again!!! Worth sharing

My personal favorites are the Turkey Panini and the Santa Fe Quesadilla. So, everyone stop The Coffee Shop on Monroe, visit with Te and Virginia, and show your support for small business owners buy ordering a drink, or even lunch!

name: A N
text: A couple of years ago, this Starbucks was not good at all. The employees were rude and the drinks were pretty mediocre. I even remember an employee lying every time I would try to order iced coffee and saying they were out because she didn’t feel like making my drink. I started going to the stand alone location down the road instead, but for the past year or so that location has really gone down and the drinks are watered down or made wrong every single time. I decided to give the Target Starbucks another chance,  and I am so glad I did. The past few times I’ve been, the employees have been friendly and the drinks are made very well and not watered down at all. I will definitely continue coming now.

name: Hannah
text: I don't normally write bad reviews but this place is bad. 😬 I had to repeat my order 5 times, then she left part of it off anyway so I just said forget it. Then the other girl called my name and put up a drink that wasn't mine, had a fuss with the girl who took the order and then handed me that drink anyway. She insisted it was right so I took it, tasted it and brought it back and let her know it wasn't right. It was supposed to be a hot chocolate and it was distinctly coffee  She was then snarky and rude, before correcting my drink. I definitely won't be back. 👎

name: Robyn E
text:
The "barista" was not friendly AT ALL. The place was dirty, with the few tables there being sticky and gross.

Our drinks were pretty standard Starbucks items but were not as high quality as the location I usually go to.

The items in the display case had apparently been in there so long, they would get a blue ribbon at the science fair.

Ol girl didn't take our names--just yelled out what we ordered as it became ready. I said "thank you" and she just spun around and walked away.

I know it's stuck in Target, but people still deserve good service--not a snotty attitude.

name: Michael Marsh
text: It's Starbucks

name: Rhiannon Coley
text: Terrible. Every single time I go here my order tastes awful. Do NOT waste your time or money here. I ordered a Caramel Frappuccino add mocha syrup with no whipped cream. Not a difficult order. I've seen it made so many times that I could probably do it myself. As the "barista" was making my drink, she was talking to one of her off-the-clock coworkers and I had to yell out to her not to put the whipped cream on it, which is what I asked for anyway and she acted as if she had an attitude because she was going to mess up MY drink. When she handed me the drink I thought the color was off but there were a million people there and I was trying to get my family home so I left before tasting the drink (big mistake) when I finally did taste the drink, it was disgusting. It had no sweet flavor. It taste like old coffee with a ton of milk and a hint of caramel syrup, probably just the drizzle she hastily applied after almost putting the whip on top. To sum it up, this was my LAST experience from this previous weekend and I will not be going back to this location again nor the other Eastchase location. Both should be shut down. I do recommend the drive to either the location on Atlanta Highway or Eastern Blvd. I have never had any issue with either of them and the Atlanta highway Starbucks makes the absolute BEST drinks ROUTINELY. I'll be buying my beverages there before any trip shopping in Eastchase. Period.

name: Stephen M
text:
Literally cannot say anything good enough about this family run food truck.

11 years in the restaurant business, trained under Savannah's late great Frank Harris of Shrimp Factory fame as well as the Tree Steak House in Jacksonville FL.

Seven Den is stunningly good.

Their humble sweetness transcends the absolute complexity and quality of their offerings.

Referred by friends who raved about it, we stopped by to try it out.

Wow, simply wow.

They could compete with anyone.

They are only open three days a week as they prep from scratch everything on the menu and it is just amazing!

Seriously try their fish tacos, get the salsa and especially the cream sauce.

They are a gift to anyone who goes.

name: Dinah Carden
text:
It saddens me to say this, as this is a new food establishment in my neighborhood.  I was really excited about the idea of a new restaurant  close and convenient to support with my patronage but I was extremely disappointed.

There are only a few things to chose from on the menu:

Several different 4" subs (and chips/drinks)

Two kinds of salad - veggie or BBQ

Several flavors of bone-in or boneless wings

The normal varieties of pizza

Hand-scooped Blue Bell ice cream - cone or cup, sundaes and milkshakes.

The employees were not very personable. They were not rude but they were not friendly either.

My order: 1 nachos, 1 BBQ nachos and a 20 piece boneless wing, half teriyaki and half mild buffalo totaled a few cents shy of $24.

The cheese on both orders of nachos was way too thick. The nachos, which were brought out immediately, were long gone before they finally got the wings out. I'd say it took right at 35 minutes for the wings to come out and the teriyaki wings were burned...not to a crisp, but burned enough so they tasted burned.

Without even considering the employees or how long it took for me to recieve my order, the quality and the cost of the food was enough for me to know I will not be going back.

On a somewhat positive note:

In had just stopped and bought my children drinks and on a whim decided to get their lunch at the All American Deli. My children were allowed to bring the drinks inside.

The ice water I ordered was free.

I was allowed to split the wings into two different flavors.

The BBQ nachos had a good portion of meat and they were tasty...even though the cheese was as thick as pudding.

Also, the buffalo boneless wings (mild) had a very good flavor but for the price, maybe adding a few slices of celery and ranch dressing would be a good idea.

text: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. They can have gluten free cupcakes available with a little notice! The macarons are beautiful, and they have ice cream and sorbet. You need to stop by!

resp.text: Thank you Beth!

name: Erin Shockey
text:
I wish i could give Dreamcakes Cafe a million star review! Wow! I visited Dreamcakes Cafe with my mother and sister for afternoon tea. It was such a special day for us because we planned afternoon tea right before they accompanied me to shop for my wedding dress! The staff knew this and were so excited, kind, and encouraging.

We made our tea selections a few days before our event via email. Kallie was wonderful about responding on email. We had to sign a contract prior to the tea and she made it very easy to do so. When we arrived to the cafe, our tea table was set up with everything we needed: teacups, utensils, saucers, even fresh flowers! The set up was stunning and the food was delicious! I highly recommend the pimento cheese sandwich with peach jam and the macarons!!

During the tea, the wait staff made us feel so special. Someone was always by to ensure we had everything we needed, refill cups, etc and all of them were SO polite, friendly, and knowledgable about tea selections. My sister had a gluten and dairy allergy and they made sure she knew what she could and couldn't eat and even brought out a special cup of chicken salad for her.

Thank you Dreamcakes staff! You made this such a special day for us. The thought and time you put into the details of our tea was noticed and SO appreciated. It was perfect from start to finish. Hope to see yall again soon... we will be back!!

resp.text:
Thank you so much Erin! It was such a pleasure working with you. We really enjoyed serving you during your tea and are so happy that you enjoyed it so much! We are pleased to accommodate all allergies and love that we were able to find the best solution for your sister. We love going above and beyond for you customers! We look forward to seeing you in the future!

- Dreamcakes Cafe Staff

name: Kathy McLaurin
text: Good cupcakes! Was a little upset that I asked for a wedding cake cupcake and after arriving home, realized they gave me a vanilla cupcake instead. I’m not a fan of plain vanilla anyway, but I didn’t finish it- the frosting had a slight “soap” taste to it. For $5 a cupcake I’m not sure it was worth it. However, I loved the other flavors provided! My advice: don’t get the vanilla, and make sure you check to make sure you pay for the cupcakes you actually want! I would have gone back, but they were already closed and it’s a 15 minute drive from where I live.

The shakes are so tasty, too. I’m thankful they don’t have milk in them. The cookies and cream is my personal favorite.

name: Robert Hughes
text:
Consistently the worst experience.  Want a sandwich with tomatoes?  They're out of tomatoes.  Want a sandwich with cucumbers? Out of cucumbers.  What about a bagel sandwich with bacon?  Out of bagels and bacon.  How about customer service?  All out of that too. But there's plenty of awful selection and rude attitude directed at their customers.

I ordered a bagel sandwich with bacon, the were out of bagels, and got no bacon.  I went back to ask about my missing bacon and was rudely told "We don't have no bacon", then the employee stormed off.  I will forego lunch and drive off campus from now on; no more 3-4x weekly visits to this awful place.

I eventually left because of how slow they were to even acknowledge us. I don't know how this place stays open. I'm hoping a decent coffee shop will open at the downtown square because Huntsville can use one

resp.text:
Anna,

This is from Cathy. one of the owners of A Cup Of Everything.

Thank you so much for letting us know about this. I will be discussing this with our managers. We work hard to offer great customer service and apologize for for your experience..

Cathy

Mr. LukiPooki

I am one of the owners of A Cup of Everything. I am very sorry you hear that you have has such poor service at ACoE. Please know that we appreciate yours and all our customer's business. If you like I eill be happy to meet you at the shop and I will personally refund you your money.

Regards
Cathy Lamberth
Clamberth@acupofeverything.com

name: Katheryn Young
text:
A Cup of Everything Convenience Store is truly convenient--a menu loaded with coffees, teas, and sandwiches primarily; and a medium-sized cache of snack bars, bottled and canned drinks, chips, and even things like headache medicine, this little restaurant/shop is a wonderful addition to the Square in downtown HSV. In addition to having just about anything you might find yourself needing while out on a stroll around downtown, or serving jury duty, etc., the staff is incredibly friendly and will (in my experience) go out of their way to ensure your good day.
However, you will be paying convenience store prices for most of their selections: a cup of coffee will only leave you a little better off than a visit to Starbucks (without the carefully constructed flavor--ACoE's coffee has been particularly bitter in my experience, even with sugar and cream), and the food can get a little pricey as well. Packaged foods, on the other hand, seem to be a bit cheaper than, say, the store inside the courthouse but it's not really enough to keep me from driving the little extra distance to the Publix at Twickenham Square.
The cozy atmosphere and neat meeting space upstairs, though, may be enough to counter-balance the slightly higher prices and not-so-awesome coffee--and a warm Spring day sat outside with a cold cup of iced tea and a fresh-made sandwich can't quite be beat.
So all-in-all, if you don't mind spending a bit more and not getting Starbucks-quality coffee, you will get a cozy, unique atmosphere great for a refreshing time on your own or with friends.

name: Super Frivolous
text:
Was soooo good.  Had a rough Friday and came in and asked for a Chocopresso, one shot expresso, one shot chocolate wine, topped with whipped cream and chocolate sauce. Took the edge right off and had served by the sweetest batista.

Would def get again.

There is one balding who is rude to everyone and makes insulting jokes to people, and he still works there!!!! The other guy had a ponytail and shaking like he was on something. text: Service and Food was a bit slow coming out. Sunday brunch seems to be quite busy here.

name: Alvin West
text:
TIGER (middle aged female Bartender/Server): One of the worst negative attitudes I have ever experienced.

After calling ahead to ask if Saturday brunch was available, I was told it may be a wait before opening due to the Fun Run in the downtown Mobile area. I and other guests were  participants in the run so there was no problem waiting. Upon waiting for several minutes after 11:00 am, we noticed some people moving around inside. We then saw a musician walk in through the main entrance. We are thinking maybe he has special permission to enter early. We then watch others approach the door looking inside. I pulled the door open, with other customers standing behind me. And before I could say anything, I was slammed with a rude statement from TIGER, "SOMEONE PLEASE LET THE OTHERS KNOW THAT APPARENTLY WE ARE OPEN!" She said this loudly with a disrespectful tone and with her hands up sarcastically gesturing the element of surprise. This is the third time I and my guests have experienced this type of service from TIGER. We tolerate her because we like Cafe 615 for the most part minus her poor service. We spoke with the manager and left Cafe 615 and went someplace else for brunch. This is my first time writing a review about TIGER's service  After three times of substandard service from TIGER  it is time to speak out about it.

name: Savannah Stanley
text: Bad service! Waiter there is illiterate and awful. We had an awful experience there two nights ago. The waiter was rude and slow, had an attitude and NO class. The food sucks. Only nice thing is the location, but NOT worth it!!!!! They need to fire the old, ugly waiter!  He is why it is always empty!!
