text: Met my mom for lunch at this sweet little cafe today. We had catfish and coleslaw, hamburger steak with onions and gravy, with green beans and fried okra. Food was really good and service was outstanding. Try it out, you’ll be glad you did!

name: Justin Hulsey
text: First time eating here, friendly staff and good home cooked food feeling. Got the Country fried stake with mashed potatoes and Cole slaw. It was as if Grandma made it at home. It's a nice little hidden gem. And the price wasn't bad at all for what you got.

name: Joshua Whiteside
text: Really good 👍. The shrimp and grits are the best around. The chicken Alfredo is also very good. Prices where fair and food was delivered fast and friendly.

name: Gerald Nowland
text: My brother and I  stopped here after a fishing trip. I got a ribeye steak sandwich. My brother got a hamburger. It's one of my favorite places to eat. I tell everyone about this place. I took my parents They loved it also.

name: jason smith (stump)
text: Nice place and food is delicious.

name: Roy Gaither
text: I had the waffles and chicken strips covered with a honey syrup. The food was excellent and the service was good as well. We will definitely go back again

name: Marcia Woodard Headrick
text:
I paid thirty four and change for a child's chicken dinner and I got country fried steak that came with two sides. $5.99 lunch special the sign said,  A small coke for the little one and I had water.
I'm thinking... what???? Thirty four and change plus tip.
Not going back there at all.

name: Whitney P
text: First time eating there and I thoroughly enjoyed it. My dad and I ordered our food to-go and waited there. The staff was incredibly polite and friendly, chit chatting with us when they could. They were very accommodating if you wanted to change something in your order that wasn't expressly on the menu and even offered us a taste of a sauce/gravy from a dish we expressed interest in trying next time. I ordered the shrimp platter grilled with broccoli for the side. I admit I didn't have very high hopes on the broccoli, I was expecting the typical butter and salt on it you find at most restaurants. However the broccoli was very well seasoned with what maybe have been a cajun type season along with the shrimp which was grilled perfectly. It came with a couple hushpuppies that were also larger then normal and tasted delicious with the shrimp. My dad ordered the fried catfish with fries and coleslaw. He enjoyed the breading and seasoning of it as well. For two meals and one coke it was only about $25 so I find it was decently priced for a home cook style meal. I will be visiting in the future and sharing my recommendations for sure! I hope they thrive and stay!

name: Lolita Mota
text: Oh my, the food is just awesome!!!  It's simply to die for... Yummy for my tummy😋

name: Frank Prusha
text: Awsome food and service all for a great price

name: Sandra Stamps
text: Love this place the food is homemade my grandson said that there county fried steak and gravy is the best around. I really like the chicken Teriyaki sauce . The service is awesome. Love this love love 😘♥️

name: Big Joe
text: Boy, this place was close—but just short. There is light at the end for this place I think, however. I come from a 20 year background in culinary environments. #1. The Door. Every single person walks in the door, it should be clean. Especially if it’s glass and surrounded by windows like yours. The handprints make interest disappear immediately. Wash those windows and door glass, I can help you with a professional it you need it. #2. Your floors. Your floors were filthy. Every customer eats seated on your floor. I’m not gonna go into more detail on that, deep clean your floors. #3. The food. For the most part the food is very good! The potato salad has way too much mayonnaise, save yourself money and flavor on that. Also, the fries should be blanched and seasoned if you’re using straight potatoes for a much crispier fry. I can show you how to do that if you need it. The chicken was good I would tell your cook to be more delicate with the Fryer, you want he fry to stay on the chicken! It all fell off. #4 and this is the biggest one because it will DESTROY your business, fights on the floors. I heard loud bickering, fighting, screaming and just a barrage of immaturity from your staff. In between a screaming child who took a fall, girls were literally fighting on the floor. That kills environment and will destroy your investment. This is your investment and one of the few options for the community to have a place to eat clean food. Come on! There is a lot of room for growth here and I hope your restaurant takes advantages of store meetings to discuss how to grow and how everyone can ultimately make more money and serve better food. If you need help please let me know. Hopefully I will have a better experience next time and be able to append this, there will be a next time—in this part of Alabama good food is SCARCE.

text: Not sure how long this lil gem has been here,  but it was a pleasant surprise. It's a cute lil place that is clean and friendly. The menu is fairly simple, but when food is as good as this, keep it like that. I has blackened chicken alfredo and husband has cajun chicken breast with 2 sides. Sandwiches and grits with shrimp, and even steak!  The fries were home made delish.  Very cute place. We will go back. It's a perfect place for quite or family.

name: randy tidmore
text: Nice to have a new option for healthy food in Alexandria.

name: Ryan Oatmeal
text: Very cute, nice, comfortable cafe for lunch. Small menu for guaranteed fresh and great food. Chicken, pork chop, cheeseburgers, philly cheese steaks, chicken salad, chop steak. Great sides, fries, fried green tomatoes, mac and cheese, potato salad. Overall a really great place. A much better option than any other restaurant around. I will definitely be back. Best thing about it, it is family owned and operated. Support local small businesses. Make them flourish.

name: John Nairemore
text: Best food great service,. Good price, easy in and out

name: Ashley Barksdale
text: Delicious frozen custard (homemade) and super friendly owners!  Must try it!  Will be a family favorite for us!

name: Lisa Lawrence
text: So happy to have found Mimi's! Had two different flavors today with large chunks of fruit oh my goodness! And hubby had an almond joy sundae!! Woohoo! Hit the spot on a hot day! Also got a poppyseed chicken casserole to take home for supper and it's delicious!!

text: Staff and food is always great!  We frequent often!!

name: Pat Kelly
text: Not a bad place to go. Dont really have everything. Stormie was more concerned with a man flirting with her over helping me get mods for the vape i bought. I will admit i love the vape but nit the customer quality from mrs Rossomme. She seemed distracted

Good prices too!!! Come see them !!

Definitely coming back

text: amazing service

name: harry cook
text: Hibachi styled food (without the show). I got a Big Bang bowl (hibachi chicken, rice, veggies in a bowl) and I liked the casual, mellow atmosphere of the place. I don't understand why people think it's ok to condescend to businesses who don't do "authentic" as if that qualifies as something lesser. I think the Japanese-fusion tag is in this case tongue in cheek for Americanized Asian food- which is authentic in itself so I have no complaints. Yay, street cafe!

name: Ker Talbot
text: I had a pourover and it was a little weak, but otherwise, i have no complaints!Awesome local coffee shop in Huntsville, Alabama. Freshly roasted beans, great company, nicely decorated, great music, and great customer service. Definitely better than Starbucks too!

name: venus9 Cotton
text: I never been can't wait to visit

name: Ker Talbot
text: One GREAT thing about this restaurant is that it's pretty dang cheap...with one notable exception. You can get a cheeseburger, fries or onion rings, and a soda for around $7.50. However, the tender plate was a touch over 10 bucks. The fries and tenders were both decent but I'm pretty dang sure they were frozen and then fried

name: Natilee M
text: Classy old school Montgomery. Excellent natural light and southern cafe fare done well. One of the few Saturday brunch options in the city. Older patronage but people drop in because of the fine arts museum it's housed in. Take nice walk on the beautiful grounds after eating. Seasonal menu that features salads and veggies as well as bacon and grits 🙌🏾

name: Janet Kissane
text: Lovely view of one of the lakes in the park while dining on great food!  Mostly filled with elder ladies, this is not a ragged blue jean/t-shirt kind of place.  The food is varied and beautiful; try the lobster roll! Service is prompt and polite. Stroll around the museum to work off that lobster roll!

name: Jarret Ramsdale
text: Great find!  We came here for the museum and we were pleased to find the cafe.Fresh seared ahi tuna and fruit infused spinach salad - awesome!Thanks to the staff and chef for a great experience.

name: harry cook
text:
I came to Cafe M 4 years ago when I was in college and I had the best crab cake benedict EVER here. I came back today to have it again and it is still delicious! It is a bit different though because they've changed their bread and I do think it was better before. Besides that the side of thinly sliced potatoes is delicious!

Service wise, it was great. Even though they were packed on a Saturday for brunch, we didn't have to wait very long and the food came out quickly too. Parking wise there is a free parking lot (first 2 hours free) right next to the cafe.

I'll be back but next time I'm going to try the French toast, which they make with Hawaiian bread!

name: Frank Hayden
text: Might be the best lobster roll I've ever had

name: Sonya' Miller
text: The staff is wonderful as well as the food. The Atmosphere and scenery is breath taking. ☆☆☆☆☆☆

name: Sheila Brooks
text: The food is wonderful and I love the quaint and lovely ambiance of this place.

name: Gina Todd
text: Such nice people. Always friendly. Very clean and relaxing atmosphere. They have a wide variety of drinks to choose from and good food as well. Would highly recommend!

name: William Tunnell
text: Would have loved to give a good review. I’m sure it’s good. Unfortunately, this place closes at 3:30pm, Wed. - Fri. Saturday 8-noon. So the hours listed are incorrect.

name: Craig Smallegan
text: Pretty good coffee place in this small town. They had a lot of syrup flavor options and we're really friendly to us.

name: Terri Loyd
text: I love this coffee shop. I usually visit at least once a week. The store is clean and really nice inside. The cakes and cookies are homemade and delicious. The lady that runs it is very sweet and remembers what I always order.

text: Great food and wonderful service!

name: Autumn Robinson
text: Best coffee and bagels ever.

name: Aimee Cornelius
text: Great coffee shop

name: jennifer sgodwin
text: Spectacular....

name: Heather Campbell
text:
THE best onion rings! Also the catfish and the pie are really, really good. This is a family run cafe, and everyone is really sweet and kind. The owner is a wonderful cook. I'm sure everything on the menu is great, but I can't get past the catfish, onion rings and pie to find out. 😊
Since it is a family business, it isn't always open during the posted hours. Give them a call to make sure they are open. It is so worth it. They treat you like family. You will feel well loved and well fed when you leave.

name: Lana Scherer
text: We loved our Po-Boy sandwiches! The batter was fabulous on both the shrimp and oyster versions and cooked to perfection. The gumbo was authentic, friendly service and a lovely view of the bay from a very modest outside patio deck where we dined while traveling with our dog. Recommended for travelers with pets.

name: Ana Boniche
text:
If you've never eaten here you're missing out!!  Now, it's very small.  That's the only bad thing.  The good thing is generally it's still fairly easy to find a place to sit.  When you do you'll be glad.
Of course the truffle fries are the BEST fries I've every eaten but really everything on the menu is delicious and the prices are so reasonable.  Especially for such gourmet make food.  We really love it!!

name: Tony Francis
text: Nice place good atmosphere and service

name: Payton Rogers
text:
I give it a 4 out of 5 because its a quant little spot that isn't crowded at lunch with a decent view of the bay.

The food was good, nothing fancy. I got the fried catfish and fries and the most flavorful thing on the plate were the hushpuppies. Which isn't necessarily bad, just nothing fancy. For the quality of food it may be a bit over priced however not terribly so.

Service was excellent and nice. I will surely come back.

name: Patricia Smith
text: The proportions where small, pricey,  but the view was good.

name: Jennie Stultz
text: Best fried okra in the world!!!!

name: Kem Hopkins
text: FYI, No longer in business

name: Christina Wilson
text: A great group of people who deliver great customer service! I had no idea this particular location was "cards only" and all I had on me was some cash in my pocket (I left my wallet in my husband's car) so the cashier, without saying anything, paid for my order! That's the sweetest thing someone has ever done for me! Thank you, Starbucks!!

name: Sarah Dixon
text: It's a busy place and no drive though but did a good job

name: Helen H. Gonzalez
text: Nice Library. A lot of references that can be used for research. A clean and quiet place. They have places for a single person and for group of people to study in. I highly recommend this library for students to spend more time in.

name: Dylan Daughety
text: This review is only long due to the 200 character bonus points you get for each review. Really, this review should be one word, but why would I do that to you. You want details and information that will sell you this Starbucks and no other. Well I can't offer that information and I can't convince to come here. It is Starbucks and it is good. Thank you for your time.

name: Khayly V
text: I come often and there’s small issues here and there but forgiving because i see that it’s always busy and I know the workers are stressed out. Today everyone was sweet up until I received my drink from the barista. She looked like she hated her job, working at her own pace (meanwhile the line is backed up and the other workers are doing multiple orders) and when she finally finishes my drink she looks at the name and scoffed and mumbles under her breath “I’m not even going to try this” and said softly the name of the drink and as she continued to make someone else’s drink, the customer was watching her and had to correct her on her own order of how to make it! So I know it was not in my head about her attitude.  If I wasn’t sitting just right there in front of her I wouldn’t have heard any of that or my order and would’ve just been waiting and have had to assume If that was my order or not. Still a good rating just a rant review

name: Aint It Chief
text: That was amazing perfect for in between classes and a problem solver for a bad start to your day

name: Sarah Armstrong
text: Everyone here works really hard and they get your drinks out quick

name: Th3r3albooboo_kitty A.K.A undiscovered
text: I do not agree with whoever is managing this place I had a coupon for a free drink with my Starbucks rewards and was told i could not use it. I understand this location has the opportunity to be on campus good for them but that does not mean become a money sink. The employees are almost always brand new for a chill vibe go to springhill instead.

name: tobias pugh
text: Pretty nice atmosphere. Good tasting food

name: Constance McGlasker
text: I love Starbucks seasonal Smores Frappuccino, Caramel Frappuccino, and Strawberry Lemonade Refresher!

name: Chastity Touchstone
text: I had an 8am meeting on campus. I decided to go to the Starbucks on campus for my morning coffee instead of driving around mobile to get to one. The sign outside the door of this Starbucks (which is inside the library) said Friday 7:30-3:30. I walked in at 7:29 and they told me they weren't open yet. I walked out and waited. I went back in at 7:33 and they ignored me  until I walked up to the counter to order and then I was told we don't open until 7:45!!! I said, "the sign says 7:30" Then she says, we haven't changed it yet.....Now, because I waited on you to open at 7:30 LIKE THE SIGN SAYS!!! I have no time for coffee. You suck. And thanks for being so rude.

name: Tim Allen
text: The staff was very accomodating with my special request & thought outside of the box to accomplish it.

text: Reason I am giving a 1 star is because I was charged 28 cents for ice. In my opinion ice should be free. I'll get my ice somewhere else from here on out.

idk what happened but the food is not the same as it was. i will be coming by again soon to see how it taste on a different day. i will say i miss the old staff, they were so friendly!
and the rest of the store is cool too! some old stuff.

name: Christine Bedford
text: Cafe is not what it used to be. Ate here Thursday and had a terrible experience with customer service and food quality. This has always been my favorite spot for lunch during the week, but something has changed and I won't be back.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Ms. Bedford. We are working very hard to re-staff our cafe after a significant staffing setback. We were training new staff last week, and are continuing to seek more new employees. We hope you will give us a few weeks to get our new staff trained and will give us another chance.

name: Jeanna Jackson
text: Love the owners.  Very nice & clean store with lots of merchandise. Lunch is great too.

resp.text: Thanks so much Jeanna!

name: Lori Hill
text: My husband had a so called club sandwich and I ordered the cheeseburger.   Well we both took one bite and threw it in the garbage.  If I could rate it a negative I would.  As much as I hate fast food I would rather have gone to McDonald's.  Waste of $25.00 plus tip and youhave to serve yourself.

name: Nancy Baird
text: Love the downtown Gadsden area and this store is one of my favorites!

text: Banana pudding Cheese cake  was  Delicious ***** please try!!!

name: George Elrod
text: Great

name: Savannah Jones
text: I'm very picky about breakfast burritos, and most places get them too greasy and falling apart. But the burrito I had here they toast it like a panini so it doesn't fall apart and it was the best tasting burrito! Sausage, cheese, egg, onions, peppers. I asked for extra cheese and a cup of salsa. Best breakfast I've had in awhile. And it was more than enough, I was worried about not having a side but I couldn't even finish my burrito.

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed it! Come see us again soon!

name: Christine Wise
text: Great food, staff and atmosphere. We just discovered this place and have already visited it twice this week. Cheddar biscuits, chicken salad, fried pies all really yummy food. Can't wait to go back and try more stuff on the menu.

name: Kim Story
text: On a whim, I stopped here today to eat lunch. I got the strawberry and pecan salad (which came with an awesome dressing btw) ,and a fried apple pie. It was delicious!!! Will definitely be going back!

name: Jillian Wright
text: Hands down the best place in Arab- or even nearby- to get fried mushrooms. They are the only place that makes them just right!

name: Pam B
text: Delicious food! Very friendly staff with great service!

name: Ann Wright
text: Food was great. Staff friendly and attentive. Perfect spot for breakfast or lunch.

name: susan WING
text: I was so excited to finally be able to stop at the Station Cafe but now I  wish I had never made that stop. I ordered a large hot latte but what I got I have no idea. It was the worst latte I'd ever had. At first I thought it was just weak coffee and the guy just forgot what I ordered but I'm  not sure if it was even that. It was frothy so he got the milk part right I just don't know about the rest of it.  I did think at the time he made it awfully quick and I commented on that to him after all a 2 shot espresso latte takes a few minutes to make. I guess he must of just left out my 2 shots. Waste of $4.  I would have return to cafe but I  was almost home before I tried the drnk and I don't live in Arab.

resp.text: I’m so sorry that you didn’t enjoy your coffee! The gentleman that made your coffee today has many years of experience as a barista and since our opening in May, we’ve  had nothing but positive feedback on anything he’s made. Next time you are in town, we’ll be happy to refund your coffee or make you another one on the house! Again, I’m terribly sorry you didn’t enjoy your experience and we’d love the opportunity to try again!

name: Ivan Croes
text: Great options! Food is delicious!

name: Ducky
text: Absolutely loved it! The food was great and so was the coffee! Wish there had been a little more atmosphere. Some music or something playing would be great!

name: Jeremy K
text:
Excellent breakfast and a reasonable price.
Best sweet treats around. And its locally owned.   Well done Guy's.

name: Stephen Bearden
text: Fantastic coffee! Burgers were delicious!!

name: Malcolm Parsons (KI4KI)
text: Good food, good service, great atmosphere.

name: BulldogReddog
text: BEST COFFEE, I’ve drunk lots of coffee around the place but this is the easily the best for the best price 10/10 the worst part is finishing my coffee

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Michael Cobb
text: Excellent food. The service was impeccable. Prices are very reasonable.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback. We value your business.

name: Ken Priest
text: Just went in to check it out

name: Pocket Bear
text: Food needs help

name: Andra Rutherford
text: Delicious food, great atmosphere, and excellent service!

resp.text: Thank you for leaving your review for our business.

name: Matthew Mabrey
text:
Delicious light-roasted . Visited twice during our week-long stay. The Bushwacker blend has incredibly flavorful berry notes that especially come out when you mix with sweet cream flavored creamer.

I normally drink my coffee straight but at the roasters recommendation I tried the Bushwacker with cream and it was delicious.

16 oz drip was $2.89
Bag of 1 lb beans was $13 ( ended up buying a bag for the rest of the week).

Tables outside and inside for use.
If you are particular about coffee, this is your spot!

name: Jennifer Seal
text: Loved our coffee from here. A local coffee shop that roasts their own beans. Great place and cute shop.

name: Honor Warren
text: I had the Salted Caramel Frappe and my daughter had a Caramel Mocha one. Both were delicious and the staff was super friendly. 10/10 recommend!

name: Leah Holland
text: Ok! Just left and will be back tomorrow! I never ever leave reviews, but felt I should because it’s soooo yummm! People were waiting so I quickly ordered my go-to caramel macchiato, which is delicious. I noticed the Bushwacker on way out and the super nice guy came over and gave me a sample with sweet cream.  Ummmm so good! So smooth, so fresh, so distinct! I’ll be back! Now sippin it on the beach. Thanks for perfection and making my day start off great! Simple joys you all provide!

name: Ed B
text: Great coffee! Sending someone from Missouri to pick up some more!

name: Adam Baldy
text: Friendly service and truly excellent breakfast sandwiches. Coffee was great as it should be.

name: Cole Schimek
text: Some of the BEST coffee I’ve had in the South! I’m from Minnesota and I like a good strong coffee and this is the BEST!! It’s awesome that he does everything by himself from getting green Coffee beans to putting it in the cup for you to drink!! Highly recommended!!!!!!

name: CausIsaid
text: Great selection. Tasty treats. Little pricey but it’s an island coffee shop. Friendly staff. Good afternoon picker upper!

name: Floyd Bakos
text: I prefer my drinks naturally flavor and sweetened. They're definitely not the one I am looking for. Mung bean milk tea is premixed which means sugar level not adjustable. Panden flavor and color are pretty artificial. It's loaded of sugar, I couldn't finished 1/4 of it. 3 stars is for the service. I drove back and got my refund promptly.

resp.text: I believe that you have the wrong restaurant. We’ve never had any type of milk teas on our menu. Please remove this review.

name: Rickey Garris
text: I'm not sure what I was more excited about...finally trying the birthday cake latte, or realizing that they sold mochi muffins here! I wanted to order one of everything but decided on the cookie butter latte, since my boyfriend ordered the birthday cake latte.

name: Cindy Mindy
text: Best coffee I have ever had in my life!!! This is a life changing experience! You must try the Cuban Latte.... WOW!  I even got to see Mark roast some of the coffee right there in his shop. This is by far the best coffee shop and my new go to when visiting Gulf Shores. I will need to stop by the Foley location on my next trip.

name: Shana Bell
text: Excellent coffee and service. The bushwhacker coffee is roasted in-house and delicious! Can buy bags in the store.

name: Joel Martin
text: Neat local coffee roaster. Friendly owner, and most importantly, smooth tasty coffee.

name: Mary Gray
text: Incredible people and super welcoming shop. I love coming here with my husband and my kids. They are super friendly and always happy to answer any questions. Used to be a die hard fan of a huge coffee chain, but since coming here I can’t wait to come back!! Amazing coffee, amazing atmosphere, amazing people, and amazing food!

name: Joshua Dinkins
text: Excellent French press coffee. Fresh roasted beans and knowledgeable staff. Thanks!

name: J
text: I discovered this beautiful coffee haven from Ciara, a very sweet employee from the hotel that I was staying at on business. It was an hour wait in the drive thru a few days after hurricane Sally hit the area. Yes, I waited that long. Let me reassure you that it was worth the wait!! It was my first time experience so I had questions. Even with the growing line behind me, Mary was so patient and kind with me. She made me the most delicious coffee that kept me coming back the entire 2 weeks I was in Foley! Thank you to the kind ladies of Southern Shores Coffee House for making my stay so very memorable! I'll be back!!!!

name: DC Home
text: Simply the best! the best service, coffee and pastries in the gulf area! treat yourself to a bushwhacker and a muffin in the morning! the coffee is fresh brewed and the pastries are home made! you won't be disappointed at either location!

name: Megan King
text: This place is absolutely incredible!!! My dad owned a coffee shop when I was younger and roasted his own beans in store which created some of the best quality coffee you could imagine. The first sip I took immediately took me back to my younger years at my dads cafe. The BEST quality coffee!! If you are ever in Gulf Shores, you have got to make this your coffee spot! You will be disappointed if you go anywhere else!!

name: Bodie Bachelor
text: Mark fresh roasts his coffee right in the shop. He makes all his own blends from green coffee grown all over the world. He has a first class Astori espresso machine & is well skilled in steaming milk for quality micro foam. The store is spotlessly clean & definitely beach themed. He went to great lengths to make sure our drinks were just right & definitely wants to please his customers. He also offers free samples of his Bushwhacker brew, which is very tasty!

name: Ruby Anderson
text: Favorite coffee in the city! And cute friendly little staff. Always pleasant and chirpy. Great to see in the morning.

name: LovelyLiddy
text:
Smoothest, best tasting coffee in Foley, hands down! Delicious house-made foods desserts, New York bagels (Their bagel sandwiches are awesome!) and macaroons straight from France.

The owners are kind, personable and open to their customers’ comments. Mark sources his beans selectively and roasts them himself at their Gulf Shores location across from Hope’s Cheesecake and his genuine passion for the craft of coffee is very apparent in the products they serve and produce.

They also have a drive-thru if you don’t want to go inside, but you should... they have a pool table and great A/C.

name: Rick Goldsworthy
text: Southern Shores is THE place to go to get a variety of locally roasted beans. Not beans roasted elsewhere and packaged for the shop (aka "private label"--which Southern Shores Coffee will do for other places). The couple I tried were solid. Note, I am not an added-flavor guy so I have no idea how any of the flavored roasts would be -- why would you do that to coffee! JK, to each his (or her) own. There are other great places in the area if you are wanting more of the cafe vibe (or gelato, more food choices, or a cuter atmosphere) but for coffee beans and great coffee, grab beans here. I tried the drip, which was good. Cannot comment on espresso base this time around so will need a return trip for that. Also, Finger Lickin' Good donuts is right next door, so you can't go wrong!

name: Hanna Slaughter
text: Super flavorful dark roast cold brew. The decor is amazing and very well designed. Service was amazing and the owners were very nice! They roast and infuse their own coffee beans and ship all over. Will definitely be coming back when we are back in town. Clean restrooms and access to a parking lot with no stairs. They also have their own roaster and dairy alternatives like almond and coconut milk! They were even able to make a decaf espresso for my mom! Definitely a great place to stop by for great coffee and friendly vibes!

resp.text: Thank you for your thorough review.

name: Jon Junkin
text: Great coffee and the hard-working owner is happy to talk shop and share his insights. I’ll be back for some more samples and to try their breakfast burritos/other breakfast offers!

name: Fink Condo Rentals LLC
text: Sweet people. Coffe is great. Many different choices and flavors. They roast onsite and have samples for you to try. We've needed a coffee shop on the island and this is great!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the review and the pictures added to google. Hope to see you again soon.

name: Montrea Posey
text: Delicious coffee- amazing people!

name: William Wright
text: Infused flavor coffee! It’s amazing you have to try the bushwhacker infused iced coffee! Also has a very nice patio to enjoy your beverage. Mins from the beach!

name: DeAnn Telarico
text: The Cuban Latte is addictive.  The owners of this shop are so nice and food and coffee are delicious.

name: manuel conde
text: The worst coffee. I just got the Bushwacher and it tasted awful. Don't waste your money. Maybe they can show me how to make it to tast like a Bushwacher. There was no paper in the box. That was misleading. I will ship it back to you. You should have disclaimer.

resp.text: While everyone has different tastes, yours is the first complaint that we’ve ever had on Bushwacker coffee. There should’ve been a paper in the box that shows which creamer to add to the Bushwacker. Ice cream cannot be roasted into coffee so we roasted the coffee to the creamer, just a little of the creamer and the coffee will taste just like the Bushwacker cocktail.

name: Katie Tackett
text: I love coming to this coffee shop every time I come to Gulf Shores!! The workers are so sweet and I always feel so welcomed when I visit. The coffee taste amazing and I even buy bags of coffee to take home with me! 100% recommend visiting this cozy coffee shop!

name: Candace Graves
text: Excellent coffee! We had a great experience! The owner is friendly and knowledgeable. He even had coffee out to sample before we made our decisions.  We will definitely be return customers on our next trip down.

name: Jennifer Reid
text: My daughter and I got lattes on our way out of town. They were delicious and we heard another gentleman telling the barista that His chi drink was the best he’d ever had.  Don’t miss this out of the way coffee shop. Egg, sausage burrito was good too.

name: Chloe Carlisle
text: very friendly staff! great iced coffee & nitro cold brew with an awesome breakfast selection. best of all— very cheap!

name: Bryan W. Rowe

name: Brian Hampton
text: The atmosphere is super chill and definitely represents the beach life. The smiles are contagious and the customer service is excellent. What about the coffee? THE COFFEE IS 🔥🔥🔥🔥

name: Pamela May
text: Southern Shores Coffee is a delight to have in the Foley area....fresh coffee, delicious treats and a soothing atmosphere... not to mention all the beautiful blondes ready to serve up the best coffees in Foley!!

name: Bre Sullivan

My favorite all vegan treats. There are few places that have such a variety of exquisite delights as this place. This is a fun and interesting atmosphere, friendly yet creatively punk hip workers will answer any question.  This place has it all.

text: We were on the hunt for coffee and found this great place. My husband always drinks an Americano and said his was delicious.  I tried the Cuban latte and found it amazing. name: Amy Henschen
text: I'm baffled by the good reviews for this place. Ordered a pour over and flat white. No one was waiting for drinks when we got there and they had 2 staff members, yet the flat white took 10 minutes and the pour over 15. Both were mediocre at best. Do not recommend.

resp.text:
I apologize for your experience. In reviewing this situation the pour over you ordered was done in an 8 cup Chemex which takes roughly 10-11 minutes with prep time start to finish. The coffee used was a light roast Ethiopian  yirgacheffe. The Yirgacheffe may not have been the coffee you as it is a light roast with a citrus note.
Please reach out to us via Facebook, email or phone 251-442-5415 as we would like the opportunity to correct this for you.

text: Absolutely delicious coffee! I ordered a hot mocha and I was not disappointed! Even my husband, who dislikes the "coffee" taste of coffee said it was good! I would definitely reccomend this place to anyone looking for some coffee in Gulf Shores!

name: Nicole Miller
text: If you’ve been looking for excellent coffee, look no further! We were visiting from Dayton, Ohio and found this gem (thank God for the coupon book at Rouse’s market). You MUST try the Bushwacker coffee (Mark’s trademarked flavor)...Hot is fantastic and the cold brew of it is even better! We went back 3 times and got extra cups of coffee to go for early beach walks the next morning....that’s how much we loved it. Also tried a Mocha with caramel and the frozen sea salt caramel, both of which were legit. Bought some whole beans and can’t wait to relive this taste of paradise when we get home. Mail order beans here we come! Thanks Mark for the enriching experience and thanks Mark’s wife for your dedication and contributions of which Mark spoke so highly!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review Nicole. It was great to meet you both, we look forward to seeing you on your next trip down.

A couple years ago, I went on a search for REAL fruit smoothies (not pre mixed powder packets) in Troy and was told to expect this place coming soon. Unfortunately, as I don't live IN Troy, I don't get up here very often in the morning.
However, this morning we were walking around downtown and I remembered i was supposed to try this place! So glad I did!
The owner was very kind and allowed me to be a little picky with my smoothie. 🤣
My husband got a brownie. I'm not totally sure it was homemade? But if it is, he gives it an A+! If it's not, its good, but less impressive. 😉
When we're around, we'll definitely try it again!

resp.text: Hello I’m glad you guys came bye and you wasn’t picky at all. All of my pastries are homemade so I’m glad he enjoyed it.

such a treasure! a blink and you will miss it spot that definitely needs to be on your list. the tea is amazing. i want it connected to an i.v.
the food is the best you will find anywhere. real southern breakfasts with pancakes the size of your dinner plate and fresh homemade biscuits. lunch specials every day. the desserts alone are worth the meal price. if you ever need a cake for any occasion or some good catering, Audra is your gal. this place is hands down the best little restaurant here in randolph co or chambers.

text: Totally awesome country home cooked meal!!! I had the lunch special which included fried chicken fingers, field peas, mash potatoes, cornbread, onion and tomato slices, peanut butter pie and ice water. The fried chicken finger receipt was just like my mom’s; brought back great memories of her cooking and a tear to my eye😢! Oh, and they are not stingy with the portions; I was miserably full😋!!!! Great atmosphere and the other patrons were friendly and welcoming as well as the employees! I will definitely be back, as well as, inquiring if they cater as far as Opelika!!!!

resp.text: We do cater in Opelika!!! Thanks for the kind words!!!

text: Ordered a cold brew - got a warm half a cup of something. Guys that's not how it works. Cold brew tastes different. "Well, we were out of cold brew so we substitute with espresso shots". How about if you are out of something you tell me and let me decide what to substitute it with? Plus why half of a cup?? I paid the full price right? Not half...My day just got worse...was so hoping for a good cup of coffee...

name: Connie Sparrowhawk
text: This experience was excellent. The one prior was very bad, that's why it is three stars. I gave them another shot, and the service was excellent!

name: Jennifer Carruth
text: The drive thru was backed up so I went inside and they were extremely friendly and helpful and gave me my requested items in a very timely manner even while they were overloaded with mobile and drive thru orders. Great people and beautiful store! Will definitely be going back over and over again! 🙂

text: I kinda wish I had not tasted Starbucks at all because I am completely addicted now!!! Lol but I will tell you I haven't met a rude person working there yet! They are so sweet to me and my dog Jinger everytime we visit. However I told them they need to get their landscaping monitored because that big tree is crooked and leaning bad and will die soon and their bushes are lacking water! Meanwhile.... I love Starbucks Jacksonville

text: When they are finally able to allow people to sit inside it will be a five star. Great place great people. Finally can sit inside. Got a great staff. Really nice people

text: They need some work

name: Amanda Newkirk
text: They didn't have my white mocha so they made something that tastes just like it! No other place has ever done that!!! I am very happy!

name: Tim Dougherty
text: I was invited to try this place and I am so glad about it. The food was seasoned perfectly. Most places just season chicken and fry it. You can tell this was brined so that it was flavorful throughout, not just the crust.  The green beans and black eye peas were great, but I would be remiss if I didn't mention the sweet tea....OMG! I'm going to ask for the secret ingredient, although I'm should they won't give it away. I'll just say, PLEASE try it for yourself.

name: Carolyn Hosea
text: The food was delicious😋😋😋 and the service was excellent. I'm definitely going to be eating here again. I recommend this Soul Food Restaurant if you're looking for Good Food  💯💯💯

text: The service is wonderful they are serving you with a smile. The food delicious!! But that dressing is 🔥🔥🔥

text: It was good, my only complaint: no gravy on the Dressin'... Gotta have gravy y'all! And the Dressin' was full of white meat 🍗...It was more like an entree, exceptional! But the Mac & Cheese alone was worth going for, delicious! However, get with the gravy for your Dressin', please Miss Sally T?? See y'all Sunday! 👍😋

name: Edwina Riddlespriger
text: Over priced for what you get. I paid for $12.09 two chicken legs (no other chicken pieces options), as small spoon of cabbage, a small spoon of squash casserole, an corn muffin and a sweet tea. The location was neat and cle and definitely has potential, however I believe in getting my money's worth.

resp.text: Sorry for the inconvenience that was the wrong price. Come see us again it'll be better 😉

text: Went for cupcakes today, red velvet.  Very young women used tongues but no gloves. Bare hands not appealing during time of covid.

name: Ann Henderson
text: My husband and visited today for Sunday dinner and was surprisingly disappointed. The food to us had lost some of it’s quality, the mac&cheese was dry, the oxtails (2) on a mountain of rice weren’t good,the turkey wing(1 flat) was small the dressing was good and the tea tasted more like water then that delicious tea we were use to accompanying our meal. I look to SallyT for a good old fashion southern meal, but as usual the cake was delicious.

name: phillip bridges
text: Should put on site ..  dine in only ..other places is open ..they are carry out only ..drove 20min ..👎

text: First time going their the food was great, we had a little mix up but how they handled it was wonderful. More people need to know about this place! Great food!

resp.text: Thank you for supporting us Tramon! Make sure and join us this Saturday for our 1 year anniversary/ customer appreciation breakfast that starts at 8am!

name: Gregory Penick
text:
1 word DELICIOUS!!!
Can't wait to bring my wife when they are serving ox tails

name: Karo Kal
text:
Sally T's has amazingly good Food for the Soul!

My son and I entered the establishment and was amazed! The cafeteria style setting was delightful, you can actually see whats being offered. We ended up ordering turkey wings and  cornbread dressing with cabbages, because they were out of collard greens. Everything was great! I have been back several times since and I am never disappointed! Please dont get me started on the desserts! I am in love with the peach cobbler cupcake, Miss Angie is putting so much love into those deserts!

The restaurant is great for groups and accommodations are great for kids as well, the restaurant is always clean and service is always great!!!! I have never seen so many smiley faces! I would definitely recommend this place, and if you are new to the area it is definitely worth a try!!!

name: Pat Felder-Cato
text:
This place was recommended to me as "buffet" restaurant. They should have said, " THEY SERVE YOU BUFFET STYLE."  The biggest disappointment was the "setup" . You walk down the  " buffet line" getting to choose a meat & 3 or 4 veggies, w/ cornbread muffin for $10.75. Your choice is placed in styrafoam to go tray & at the register you are given choice tea , water or punch also in styrafoam. No dessert comes with the meal. It's a choice of 2 cupcakes at a cost of $ 1.75 or $ 2.25 ea. Only drink  allowed. drink. Though, I did enjoy my veggie plate, the portions were a little in the small side. The dinning room itself was spacious and tastefully decorated. I'm not knocking small beginnings. I give props and praise to owners for acting on the dreams. But I suggest that you get a coach or mentor
of someone already in the restaurant business who can give you pointers on how to improve even on your level. That's called being wise and protecting your investment by pouring by into it.

name: Mz. Nikki
text: Today was my first time visiting, and it definitely won't be my last. We were greeted with smiling faces and friendly service. The food was absolutely ahhhmazing!! If you like ox tails, please look no further, they are the absolute best! Thanks Sally T's for a pleasurable experience. 🙌🏾👌🏾

name: Sherita Watts
text: The food was so good! Generous portions and a friendly staff. I'll definitely be going back.

name: Nathan Reed
text: Small portions but overall good food... Its just if you are going to give me small portions then why am I paying 50% more... Learn your price point and your customer... Either lower the price or give me more... Also the walking to one end of the space for my food and then to another end to pay was confusing...

name: Lori Flowerz
text: Food was reasonably priced, delicious and flavorful. I will definitely be back!!!! Excellent!

name: Danita Jones
text: Good soul food. Only critiques..more seasoning. The oxtails and tips are so bland. And a thicker gravy to add flavor to the beef. Other than that, I'm a regular customer now

name: Will Lewis
text: Great food and amazing cupcakes! Staff is super friendly and always smiling! Owner knows what she is doing! You HAVE to check this little gem out.

name: Tamara Jenkins
text: Fresh, seasoned well, not over cooked, pleasant employees.  Timely service.

text: I love the drive thru coffee shop. I mostly get their medium cup of coffee with cream and little honey. The folks are pleasant and always provide exceptional coffee.Delicious coffee! Just a drive thru from what I can tell but I'm not mad about it.Coffee is great, staff is always friendly! Convientent drive thru!

name: Blake B
text: CUSTOMER BEWARE!! The barber seemed angry when I walked in. I showed him a picture of the hairstyle I wanted. He never asked how short I wanted to keep the top of my hair. Or anything else about the cut after he saw the picture. He cut it very very short. He was also very short with me when trying to make conversation and while cutting my hair he was very abrasive and just slung my head wherever he needed it to go. Very very displeased with the service even though I did tip. He Never even asked my opinion until it was too late to make changes and by that point there was nothing I could do!!

text: Really friendly staff, lots of space to relax or do some work. More people need to know about this place!

text: Lovely staff, delicious bagels and coffee! The atmosphere is welcoming and spacious and I truly see a lot of potential here! Definitely swing by for some coffee or good conversation! Will be back :-)

resp.text: Thank you, Taylor, for your 5 star review. We are just getting started and are adding more to our menu weekly. Tell your friends and bring them with you.

name: Jaimie Roper
text: Three things that make this place a standout in Auburn. 1-Food and drink. This place makes a FANTASTIC dirty chai! Be sure to grab a hot, fresh Kolache, with lots of flavors to choose from. I also tried a fresh strawberry muffin that was scrumptious. 2. The mission. The food and coffee is top notch, but what really makes this place special is their mission. All workers are volunteers, so they can give back every cent they make to Auburn’s community. This is a meal you can feel good about, knowing your money is going to something for the greater good. 3. The space. Inside, there are lots of seats and cozy meeting spaces. They also have a dedicated pool room, as well as board games to play. A wonderful place for socializing, solo-work, or group meetings.

resp.text: Jamie, thank you for the glowing review. Next time you come in, show this review to the Cafe, bring a friend, buy a menu item ,and get one of equal or lesser value free(not valid with other offers).

name: Benjan Starkly
text: I have heard awesome things about Eden Cafe. But when every time I try to go by there, they are closed. I read great reviews on google, but yelp has them as horrible. I want to see for myself. I wonder if they are going under like most business in this shopping center.

name: Clair Russell
text: Every time I try to go here they are closed... maybe don’t post that you open at 8am if you never open at 8am? They have good food and coffee you know IF they’re open.

name: Ashlynn Martin
text: Very different tasting coffee.. BUT EXTREMELY GOOD coffee. Love the atmosphere and mission, too. Will be a frequent customer.

resp.text: Thank you for the five star review. We desire to be servant leaders in the Auburn community. Our goal is not profit, it is make a difference within the community by providing a unique atmosphere which encourages people to connect with each other. We have plenty of space for events and parties too. Each week until our grand opening we’ll be adding new menu items weekly. Check back often. As always get Nekkid in Eden! 😉

name: Joshua Marshall
text: Great coffee, great food, and most of all great people! Their Irish cream frappe is soooooo good (dare I say better than Starbucks)!! A definite recommendation to all those who love coffee!

resp.text: Better than Starbucks? Please hold us to a higher standard. 😉 We’re joking. Thank you so much for a great review! We are here to serve and never want our service or product to fall below a five star review. Tell your friends. As we all succeed together our community thrives! Thanks again for stopping by.

name: Jessica Hartley
text: Great place! Yummy coffee and muffins and very friendly people with a wonderful mission. Will be back

resp.text: Thanks for your review. We’re still learning how to best serve the Auburn community. Your feedback is appreciated.

text: Love it. Friendly staff and great affordable prices. Recommend everyone try them out.

resp.text: Thanks for your review! Everything we do is meant to help our Auburn community thrive.

resp.text: Thanks for the positive Review Timothy.

resp.text: Thank you Ernie for the 5 star review! We agree! We should all support our local economy. All of our proceeds are reinvested directly in the Auburn community.

resp.text: Thanks so much LulaRoe’ we appreciate the positive review!

text: Amanda literally pulled me from the street as I was walking to get a monster from Winn Dixie! That quad shot macchiato with almond milk(and the complementary  chocolate chip muffin) got my morning going! New drink every day!!! Idk what kind of espresso they use but the taste is there, no bitterness, and didn't give me a crash like most espresso drinks do. Bravo Amanda! And to Caitlyn, who made my drink, you da bomb!!!! Ps...Pastor Scott ain't all that bad at her job either!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review Cody. We are glad you liked it! Come get Nekkid in Eden anytime and bring a freind!

If you don't buy tickets there are still plenty of animals to pet and trail to walk.

My friends and I tried the menudo and it was the cleanest and freshest tasting menudo we've ever had. The tacos we tried- al pastor, asada, chorizo, and another I don't remember were all perfect and even better than any taco truck in Bhm. Can't wait to come back!

text:
Best Mexican food in Birmingham.  This guy is a chef and this is the real deal.  Wow.  New favorite restaurant.  Cafe Castillo - Inside Ashley’s in Hoover.

Monday-Thursday 10-6:30
Friday and Saturday 10-8:45pm

They have real tamales on Tuesday and Saturday after 4pm.

They have pozole, street tacos, huge tortas (amazing) and real horchata!

name: Drew Thomas
text:
One of my favorite restaurants in birmingham. The ingredients are so fresh and everything goes together perfectly.

Very reasonable prices for what i consider the best sandwich I've ever had (the azada torta)

It is inside a furnature store, and if that bothers you, just take the food to go. You will not be disappointed.

text: Conveniently located (for students) in the LRC building. Nearly inaccessible for others. Can be busy at lunch, and at the top of every hour when classes change. Prices and taste are good, but not notable. Staff are nice,  even when the line of customers stretches out the door.

text: It is what it is. Quick bagels and food that is convenient but nothing to write home about. Can't complain. Very fast and pretty cheap for a bagel.

name: Matthew Pearson
text:
If you're a UAB student, just go here.. Skip Panera and Starbucks if you're looking for food. The sandwiches here are SO MUCH better than Panera. I mean in another league. And they cost less.

I have yet to try their coffee, but as they seem to serve caribou coffee, I am sure it will be more than adequate. I will be skipping Starbucks except when I am in the mood for a frappuccino.

YES it is worth the walk(not really far from anything anyways). Even better if you live in Blazer or NFR.

It may not be the absolute best food out there, but for UAB students with dining dollars? Best I've had. That is unless you want a burger.

tl;dr Best food I've had at UAB unless you're craving for a burger, then go the Den.

text:
I love coming here to get coffee. Today though there was a lady with blue hair, I didn’t get her name down though. She showed excellent customer service to the two girls in front of me but when it came time to take my order specifically she was showing terrible customer service...but passively. Like she didn’t want to take my order but had to since I was already there. She didn’t ask if I wanted my receipt and she didn’t give me a straw and sugar for my coffee either like she did the other two girls in front of me. I had to ask, and when I did she seemed a bit hesitant to give them to me. Like I was taking up her time. I was having kind of a bad day that day and this is why we (especially if you work in customer service) should always strive to at least TRY to treat people with decency...I’m also aware we all have our bad days though and nobodies perfect. You never know what other people are gong though truly. I’m a bit skeptical on coming back here because I don’t wanna have another employee lowkey making me feel bad, especially if I might be having another bad day next time as well. I’ll just have to go to the one by the mall and wait in The line for a little minute, might take longer but they’re customer service is always on point.
Anyway hope Whoever is reading has a great day

name: Spencer Sumner
text:
NERDtorch cafe is the next big thing for Opelika/Auburn and people that love video games, anime, and all things nerd culture. Nigel and Leilani run the store and are two of my favorite people. They get to know their customers very well and it makes the atmosphere feel like you're walking in to a good friends house to play the day away with some Smash Bros or Halo.

Leilani makes the best tacos I have ever had in my life. If you get the chance, go to Taco Tuesday. You won't regret it. In fact all the food is delicious. An order of double fries or nachos goes perfect with a D&D session.

Nigel has the uncanny ability to bring fun wherever he goes. He's set up the cafe to accommodate nearly any genre of nerd from retro gamers to hardcore tournament competitors. He's also constantly working to improve his business and make sure everyone that walks in the door has a great time. He also runs a pretty dope YouTube channel called Nerd Torch TV.

The store is organized and managed extremely well. There are several rooms dedicated to different types of gaming. There is a room for tabletop games, another for rhythm games like Guitar Hero or DDR, and other rooms dedicated to console games. There's even a PC built for gaming. Multiplayer games are very popular and this is a great place to find people that love to play Smash. I don't think I've ever been to the cafe when there wasn't someone playing Smash or Mario Cart. There's a great community built up around the cafe as well. All of the cafe members are invited to a GroupMe chat where you can get updates on events or just chat and hang out. This year, they organized a secret santa for everyone.

If you love games, nerds, and having a good time then you won't be dissapointed if drop by NERDtorch Cafe.

resp.text: Thanks so much for writing such a detailed description of NERDtorch Cafe! It means a lot that you would go to such efforts to show your appreciation like this. I'm glad we have you in our community and I know you'll keep making D&D nights awesome.

name: Kayden Pate
text: Horrible experience. Absolutely awful. I ordered two drinks it was SUPPOSED to be a Iced Mocha Coffee and a Chai Latte, instead I got two coffee flavored waters. The coffee was so watered down that the Iced Mocha only had a after taste of coffee. The Chai lattee was so watered down that I couldn't even taste the Chai. Our drinks were literally water. Don't even get me started on the wait time. We were the only people ordering and waiting for our food and it still took them 15 minutes to make our drinks. I won't be coming back. I went toward the middle of August.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  I also enjoyed your review of the Sims 4 Vampire Expansion on your Youtube channel.  Looking at our transaction history, we haven't sold a Chai Latte recently. If you would kindly let me know when you visited Daily Bagel in Pell City, AL, I will be happy to issue you a refund for your drinks. Thanks!

text: Couldn't help but to notice this little mom and pop store. It's inviting as you enter. However,  the dessert were not good. I paid $3 for a hard cupcake.  It was not moist at all!!! Likes it been keep the refrigerator for hours. My mother order the pecan pie the pecans were old and crust was soggy. Let's be honest!!! You (Cara) was in the kitchen preparing someone else's order. So, therefore your so called message wasn't conveyed  🙄 nor did the gentleman that took our order. I know what I know because I was there.

resp.text: The cupcake Ms. Jackson purchased was baked fresh the day she bought it. I told her to let it warm up before eating it, as it had been refrigerated. The pecan pie also was fresh. I tasted it yesterday and it was darned near perfect. I’m sorry she was unhappy. We will refund her money or give her replacement deserts.

name: christian warr (McPandaSwag)
text: This place was absolutely terrible in all of the food that was served to our table. We had to wait 45 minutes for them to bring out a couple of sandwiches and a salad with ranch dressing that tasted like sour cream. I even requested one thing to not be on something and yet after the 45 minute wait the item is still put there. I had 3 other people with me and they also had the same complaint of how the food and dressing is. I got a sandwich with bread that was basically rock hard and broke up in little pieces. I did not pay for this either. So in my opinion you are testing your luck with going to this place and getting good food.

name: Tim Griggs
text: We recently became aware of Cara's Cafe and really wanted to try it. Cara's Cafe was previously Frankie's Deli and we had been there a few times and really enjoyed it. We got a glimpse of Cara's menu via Facebook and found quite a few entries we were anxious to try. We finally made it to Cara's yesterday (3 Jul 2020) for lunch.  We were greeted immediately upon entering and grabbed a paper menu to make our selections.  Making just 2 selections was tough, as everything sounded delicious.  For lunch, we opted on a Pesto Chicken Salad Sandwich on Croissant and the Mufalletta Sandwich on a French roll. Several counter pastries caught our eye as we were going over the menu so we added a piece of German Chocolate Cake, 2 Cannoli's, a frozen Peach Cobbler (for later consumption), and 2 Blueberry-Lemon cupcakes.  Cara's also offers frozen casseroles to take home and heat up, so we opted to grab a Jumbalaya with Conecuh Casserole for a 4th of July lunch.  After we received our sandwiches and our remaining order was bagged, we ventured over to the Alleyway in downtown Wetumpka for an outdoor table. Both sandwiches were EXCELLENT and the Italian Pasta Salad was DELICIOUS! We followed our sandwiches with the Cannoli's and cupcakes and they were just as DELICIOUS as everything else! While at the Wetumpka fireworks show last night, we gobbled up the German Chocolate Cake which was also DELICIOUS! We cannot wait to try the Jumbalaya Casserole today and Peach Cobbler.  We also had a great conversation with Bert and Katie while we were there.  They were so helpful and courteous! It goes without saying, we will be back to Cara's soon to try some other things...

name: Cathy Hegji
text: Service very friendly, cannoli are delicious. Will be back for more

resp.text: Thank you, Cathy! I appreciate your kind words.

name: john johnson
text: really nice home town place to chill, and best catfish dinner on the block...and ther coconut pie! you gota try it..says the jj

resp.text: Glad you enjoyed it.  Thanks for coming :-)

name: Jesse Hinkson
text: Do yourself a favor... eat somewhere else. The food was terrible. My burger was charred on both sides, the fried green tomatoes were so thick that the were barely cooked, didnt get the chips that were supposed to come with the burger, the cheese sticks were so overcooked that 6 out of 6 had no cheese in them, basically i got over cooked breading tubes.... there was no care whatsoever put into the preparation of this order, and the fact that theres no possible way the person who cooked this food didnt realize any of this makes it clear that quality just isnt important to them. Seriously, go somewhere else, this is one of the most disappointing meals ive ever had.

resp.text: I have spoken with the waitress, and she informed me that the meal was shown before it went out the door.  If later it was not up to par, you have our apologies, and the next meal is on us.  Feel free to ask for me (Nolan) directly if you have any concerns in the future.

name: Cynthia Gosa
text: Just had breakfast here yesterday for the very first time. I had the blueberry pancakes they were awesome! my husband got the ham and cheese biscuit in my mother-in-law got a full breakfast, everything was great piping hot and fresh! Danielle was our server and she was very very friendly. Made us feel like we were eating in our own home. I would highly recommend this place for a quick bite or a meal.plan on going back for one of their steak or seafood dinners can't wait!!

text: Wow..Caesar salad was soooo good. King cake martini was right on point. Service was even better. Ashley and DJ were so attentive and friendly even though it was busy.  We will definetely be back and will tell our friends about this visit.

text: Today I ordered the Joe Cain Pizza and the Greek Salad. They both were really Good! The customer service was awesome and my order was correct. Its been years since I ordered food here but, I have always had a great experience! Keep up the great work to the staff at Joe Cain Cafe!😗

text: Very nice and the food is excellent. I recommend the Caesar salad with spicy cajun shrimp.

text: It was a fair and decent restaurant/sports bar.

name: Stefan Russell
text: I was there with my elderly parents last Friday, July 31, 2020 for a late lunch. To say the two staff were welcoming, professional and pleasant is an understatement. They were absolutely delightful. So attentive, so friendly and nice. I would love to go back every day! The food was stupendous and tasty too. The pizza, gumbo and chicken wrap were delicious and ample. We all had to take food home because the portions were so ample. Great drinks too! But really, great food was super, but the staff was the most memorable part. Thank you for hiring such great individuals!

text: My first visit to Joe Cain Cafe wasn't the greatest, but thankfully my second visit offered redemption.I usually (and randomly) find myself at The Battle House in need of late night bites. Joe Cain saves the day, but I wish they offered better (or craftier) drinks. The staff is friendly and quick to expedite orders. The prices are great!

text: I had a delicious shrimp avacado wrap and good craft beer. My husband had an amazing prime rib Panini and a mixed drink that was a very generous pour. We had very good service considering how busy the place was.

name: Jakara Watson
text: Customer service was very poor. This was the first time I didn't leave a tip. The waitress only served me water. She never took our order, we went to the counter to order. Then they never brought our checks to us. Luckily for them, I'm an honest person. I paid for the food, and asked for the manager. He was apologetic and said that he would take care of the check. I wouldn't recommend them, and I wouldn't go back. They get no stars from me. But I have to put at least one in order to post my review.

name: Kimberly Stiegler
text: The ABSOLUTE WORST! Along with an awful day at the BHS. I got a shrimp and avacado wrap, no taste at all, salt and peppered it as much as I could, when about 1/2 way thru it, I found a large white soft spongy mass. I could only HOPE it was a lost piece of chicken that never got cooked.  Never again!

name: Kennedy Moore
text: Tina the bartender refused to serve me a drink after viewing my driver's license. She "didn't feel comfortable" serving me. I'm 21. My driver's license is legitimate. I verified my ID using the Alabama ID verification website. She had no reason do deny me a drink. I will never return. I will never recommend this place. And Tina has terrible customer service skills. I'm a bartender and in school for Hospitality Management. I would never treat a guest the way I've been treated tonight.

name: John Norris
text: I must have had on my cloak of invisibility when I went to Joe Cain's. No one greeted me when I entered. No one bothered to take my order. No one noticed when I left. No worries, as I went up the street to Delphina's and had a great meal. With that said, if you want to have drinks with tipsy, middle management types from out of town staying at the hotel, I suppose this place is as good as any.

name: Krystal Littrell
text: Horrible. They never have to go orders ready on time. We picked up from them for our work weekly and were told our orders would be ready no later than 11:20 and we wouldn't get our food that was for meetings until 11:40a-11:45am. Also, I've been on hold as I type this for 8 minutes. Someone answered and asked if I could hold and it's now been 8 minutes and no one has checked on me on the phone. We will be taking them off our staff lunch menu

Renaissances must have a street front restaurant, and this one slumps in the corner and grumbles " I have to be here."
Frozen pizza crust, salty nachos and sad burgers. Beautiful space, and a good place to be seen, but they are; too over priced for the 10$ Downtown crowd, too slow for room service, and too casual for the hotel.  It's like putting candles and table cloth at Checkers.

text: This place gets better the longer it is opened! I haven't been in awhile and I was plesantly surprised today! Being a diabetic, i was pleased to see they had added several flavors to the sugar free selection. I also bought some cheese straws while there and visited the adjoining shop while I was waiting on my latte. I would recommend this place to anyone who enjoys a good cup of coffee.

text: Great place to eat or get a cup of coffee! I live in sylacauga and can tell you hands down this is the best place to get coffee I love this place and you can tell from the minute you walk in its a friendly Christian atmosphere. God bless!
